name: Thrumbolg, First Lord of Mag Tureah

description.value: Enemies can't gain combat advantage by flanking Thrumbolg.
If Thrumbolg starts his turn conscious but unable to take actions, Area dbhar attacks on its own, using Thrumbolg's Area dbhar attack as no action.

When Thrumbolg drops to 0 hit points, his body and possessions disappear, but he is not destroyed. He reappears in Mag Tureah at full hit points and with his possessions after the next sunrise or sunset. If an attack made with Fragarach drops him to 0 hit points, Thrumbolg does not rise again.
Thrumbolg can see invisible creatures and objects.

Basic Attack

At-Will ✦ teleportation, weapon

Standard

Attack: Melee 3 (one creature)

+30 vs. AC

Hit: 5d8 + 11 damage, and Thrumbolg teleports the target up to 5 squares.

Basic Attack

At-Will ✦ weapon

Standard

Attack: Ranged 50 (one creature)

+30 vs. AC

Hit: 2d12 + 10 damage, and the target takes ongoing 10 damage and is immobilized (save ends both).

First Failed Saving Throw: Ongoing 15 damage and the target is restrained (save ends both).

Effect: Gae Bulg returns to Thrumbolg's hand after each attack.

Encounter ✦ poison, psychic

Standard

Attack: Ranged 10 (one bloodied creature)

+28 vs. Fortitude

Hit: The target takes poison and psychic damage equal to its bloodied value.

Miss: The target takes poison and psychic damage equal to its healing surge value.

At-Will ✦ teleportation

Move

Effect: Thrumbolg teleports up to 10 squares.

At-Will 1/round

Minor

Effect: Thrumbolg uses one of the following evil eyes. This attack does not provoke opportunity attacks. While bloodied, Thrumbolg can use two different evil eyes, each against a different target.

1. Eye of Command (charm): Ranged 10; +28 vs. Will; the target is dominated until the end of Thrumbolg's next turn.

2. Eye of Death (necrotic): Ranged 10; +28 vs. Fortitude; 2d6 + 9 necrotic damage, and the target is weakened until the end of Thrumbolg's next turn.

3. Eye of Obeisance (psychic): Ranged 10; +28 vs. Will; 2d6 + 9 psychic damage, and the target falls prone and cannot stand up until the end of Thrumbolg's next turn.

4. Eye of Pain: Ranged 10; +28 vs. Fortitude; the target gains vulnerable 10 to all damage until the end of Thrumbolg's next turn.

5. Eye of Retribution (force, psychic): Ranged 10; +28 vs. Will; until the end of Thrumbolg's next turn, whenever the target damages Thrumbolg, the target takes 15 force and psychic damage.

6. Eye of Terror (fear, psychic): Ranged 10; +28 vs. Will; 3d6 + 9 psychic damage, and the target grants combat advantage until the end of Thrumbolg's next turn.

At-Will ✦ weapon

Triggered

Trigger: An enemy is bloodied by one of Thrumbolg's attacks.

Effect (Immediate Reaction): Thrumbolg makes a basic attack against the triggering enemy.

At-Will 1/round

Triggered

Trigger: Thrumbolg is conscious and an enemy starts its turn within 5 squares of him.

Effect (No Action): Thrumbolg uses one random evil eye against the triggering enemy.

system.biography:
HP 466; Bloodied 233
Immune blinded, dominated, sleep 		Init +18 | AP 1 | Save +2
AC 39Fort 37Ref 37Will 38
Speed 8
Ability ScoresStr 27 (+20)
Con 25 (+19)		Dex 22 (+18)
Int 25 (+19)		Wis 20 (+17)
Cha 28 (+21)
Languages Common, Elven
Alignment Evil
Skills Arcana +24, Athletics +25, Bluff +26, Diplomacy +26, Dungeoneering +22Senses Darkvision
Passive Perception 27 | Insight 27

Equipment Areadbhar (spear), Gae Bulg (javelin)

Traits

[[/roll 0#<p style="background-color:green;color:white;"> <b>All-Around Vision</b> <b></b></p><p>Enemies can’t gain combat advantage by flanking Thrumbolg.</p>]] All-Around Vision

Enemies can’t gain combat advantage by flanking Thrumbolg.

[[/roll 0#<p style="background-color:green;color:white;"> <b>Areadbhar"s Wrath</b> <b></b></p><p>If Thrumbolg starts his turn conscious but unable to take actions, Areadbhar attacks on its own, using Thrumbolg’s Areadbhar attack as no action.</p>]] Areadbhar"s Wrath

If Thrumbolg starts his turn conscious but unable to take actions, Areadbhar attacks on its own, using Thrumbolg’s Areadbhar attack as no action.

[[/roll 0#<p style="background-color:green;color:white;"> <b>Cheating Fate</b> <b></b></p><p>When Thrumbolg drops to 0 hit points, his body and possessions disappear, but he is not destroyed. He reappears in Mag Tureah at full hit points and with his possessions after the next sunrise or sunset. If an attack made with Fragarach drops him to 0 hit points, Thrumbolg does not rise again.</p>]] Cheating Fate

When Thrumbolg drops to 0 hit points, his body and possessions disappear, but he is not destroyed. He reappears in Mag Tureah at full hit points and with his possessions after the next sunrise or sunset. If an attack made with Fragarach drops him to 0 hit points, Thrumbolg does not rise again.

[[/roll 0#<p style="background-color:green;color:white;"> <b>Truesight</b> <b></b></p><p>Thrumbolg can see invisible creatures and objects.</p>]] Truesight

Thrumbolg can see invisible creatures and objects.
